communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All internal correspondence related to clinical trial NCT04650217 from November 1, 2020 to July 31, 2022; and all internal correspondence related to clinical trial NCT03761030 from April 1, 2020 to July 31, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brady Huggett

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

DWI videos from the last two DWI's that ended in the conviction of Sherre Johnston. Ms. Johnston is in the penitentary and the cases have been disposed of making the DWI videos and other information, such as officer reports, blood alcohol or breath test results available. I would also like all FIVE dash cam videos from the Sheriff's department from the disposed of by dismissal case against Sherre Johnston for the burglary of a habitation, which was Truman Simons' house. There are videos and reports from this that are now available under the Open Records Act that I am entitled to that will be very interesting to the public. Also, all officer reports from the burglary of a habitation, i.e. the Simons' house. In the public interest I am asking for ALL videos and audios of this event and the two DWI's. Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Fentanyl-laced cannabis
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any record in possession of the Office of Cannabis Management as of May 1, 2023 mentioning or describing the existence of cannabis laced with fentanyl or which warns about cannabis laced with fentanyl. 

Attached, please find a PDF describing an event where Mayor Eric Adams has publicly stated that there is cannabis laced with fentanyl being sold to children in bodegas in New York City. The Mayor having disclosed this information publicly, there is no basis to cite law enforcement secrecy or "For Official Use Only" markings. The examination of this claim and its source is a matter of public interest which outweighs virtually all claims of an interest in withholding records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Records of Fentanyl-laced Cannabis
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any record in possession of the Office of Mayor as of May 1, that was received from any law enforcement agency at any time between the date of January 1, 2022 until April 30, 2023, that mentions or describes the existence of cannabis laced with fentanyl or which warns about cannabis laced with fentanyl. 

A list of possible sources of this information (that is neither exhaustive nor exclusive) may include intelligence bulletins published by the New York City Police Department, the New York State Police, the NYC Special Narcotics Prosecutor's Office,  the U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration, the Office of National Drug Control Policy, the Department of Homeland Security, and/or the New York/New Jersey HIDTA. 

Attached, please find a PDF describing an event where the Mayor has publicly stated his knowledge that there is cannabis laced with fentanyl being sold to children.

As the Mayor has repeatedly alluded to the existence of cannabis laced with fentanyl at New York City bodegas, the Office of Mayor has waived any right to invoke law enforcement secrecy, or cite For Official Use Only/"FOUO" markings (that have no legal standing) or similar exceptions to FOIL. 

There is no forseeable harm in disclosing a document claiming that cannabis is laced with fentanyl, and the examination of these records as well as the source of the claim that cannabis is laced with fentanyl is a matter of ongoing public concern. As such, there is no legal reason to withhold the requested records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee
